newsitem.title: UK: Administrators sell Lord Rayleigh's Dairies to MD.
newsitem.headline: Administrators sell Lord Rayleigh's Dairies to MD.

text.p: Substantially all the business and assets of Lord Rayleigh's Dairies Ltd, in administration, has been sold to MD Foods UK Plc, a subsidiary of MD Foods International A/S, administrators Coopers & Lybrand said.
MD Foods, part of the Danish dairy farmers' cooperative MD Foods Amba, paid an undisclosed cash or cash equivalent, Coopers & Lybrand joint administrator Chris Barlow told Reuters.
The business was sold as a going concern and all jobs are protected, Barlow said.
Lord Rayleigh's Dairies is based near Chelmsford, eastern England and went into administration just three days' ago.

Coopers & Lybrand said in a statement the company had experienced "tough trading conditions due to a number of factors including the rising costs of raw milk and intense competition in the marketplace."
Some 80 percent of MD Foods turnover is in Britain.
